letters.description: Explore the client's spiritual background, beliefs, and current relationship with faith. Identify strengths and resources rooted in their faith tradition.
Guide the client to accept their past, acknowledge their present struggles with compassion, and recognize the impact of addiction or other challenges on their faith.
Facilitate the integration of faith-based principles and practices into the recovery process. Help the client set intentions aligned with their values and spiritual goals.
Support the client in experiencing transformative growth through faith. Cultivate trust in a higher power and the recovery process.
Encourage the client to establish holistic harmony by nurturing their spiritual, emotional, mental, and physical well-being, fostering sustainable recovery.
